verses.verse: "However <S%H199><s%> now, Job, <S%H347><s%> please <S%H4994><s%> hear <S%H8085><s%> my speech, <S%H4405><s%> And listen <S%H238><s%> to all <S%H3605><s%> my words. <S%H1697><s%>
"Behold <S%H2009><s%> now, <S%H4994><s%> I open <S%H6605><s%> my mouth, <S%H6310><s%> My tongue <S%H3956><s%> in my mouth <S%H2441><s%> speaks. <S%H1696><s%>
"My words <S%H561><s%> are [from] the uprightness <S%H3476><s%> of my heart; <S%H3820><s%> And my lips <S%H8193><s%> speak <S%H4448><s%> knowledge <S%H1847><s%> sincerely. <S%H1305><s%>
"The Spirit <S%H7307><s%> of God <S%H410><s%> has made <S%H6213><s%> me, And the breath <S%H5397><s%> of the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> gives <S%H2421><s%> me life. <S%H2421><s%>
"Refute <S%H7725><s%> me if <S%H518><s%> you can; <S%H3201><s%> Array <S%H6186><s%> yourselves before <S%H6440><s%> me, take <S%H3320><s%> your stand. <S%H3320><s%>
"Behold, <S%H2005><s%> I belong to God <S%H410><s%> like you; I too <S%H1571><s%> have been formed <S%H7169><s%> out of the clay. <S%H2563><s%>
"Behold, <S%H2009><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> fear <S%H367><s%> of me should terrify <S%H1204><s%> you, Nor <S%H3808><s%> should my pressure <S%H405><s%> weigh <S%H3513><s%> heavily <S%H3513><s%> on you.
"Surely <S%H389><s%> you have spoken <S%H559><s%> in my hearing, <S%H241><s%> And I have heard <S%H8085><s%> the sound <S%H6963><s%> of [your] words: <S%H4405><s%>
'I am pure, <S%H2134><s%> without <S%H1097><s%> transgression; <S%H6588><s%> I am innocent <S%H2643><s%> and there is no <S%H3808><s%> guilt <S%H5771><s%> in me.
'Behold, <S%H2005><s%> He invents <S%H4672><s%> pretexts <S%H8569><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> me; He counts <S%H2803><s%> me as His enemy. <S%H340><s%>
'He puts <S%H7760><s%> my feet <S%H7272><s%> in the stocks; <S%H5465><s%> He watches <S%H8104><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> my paths. <S%H734><s%>'
"Behold, <S%H2005><s%> let me tell <S%H6030><s%> you, you are not right <S%H6663><s%> in this, <S%H384><s%> For God <S%H433><s%> is greater <S%H7235><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> man. <S%H582><s%>
"Why <S%H4069><s%> do you complain <S%H7378><s%> against <S%H413><s%> Him, That He does not give <S%H6030><s%> an account <S%H6030><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> His doings <S%H1697><s%>?
"Indeed <S%H3588><s%> God <S%H410><s%> speaks <S%H1696><s%> once, <S%H259><s%> Or twice, <S%H8147><s%> [yet] no <S%H3808><s%> one notices <S%H7789><s%> it.

"In a dream, <S%H2472><s%> a vision <S%H2384><s%> of the night, <S%H3915><s%> When sound <S%H8639><s%> sleep <S%H8639><s%> falls <S%H5307><s%> on men, <S%H376><s%> While they slumber <S%H8572><s%> in their beds, <S%H4904><s%>
Then <S%H227><s%> He opens <S%H1540><s%> the ears <S%H241><s%> of men, <S%H376><s%> And seals <S%H2856><s%> their instruction, <S%H4148><s%>
That He may turn <S%H5493><s%> man <S%H120><s%> aside <S%H5493><s%> [from his] conduct, <S%H4639><s%> And keep <S%H3680><s%> man <S%H1397><s%> from pride; <S%H1466><s%>
He keeps <S%H2820><s%> back <S%H2820><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%> from the pit, <S%H7845><s%> And his life <S%H9130><s%> from passing <S%H5674><s%> over <S%H5674><s%> into Sheol. <S%H7973><s%>
"Man is also chastened <S%H3198><s%> with pain <S%H4341><s%> on his bed, <S%H4904><s%> And with unceasing <S%H386><s%> complaint <S%H7379><s%> in his bones; <S%H6106><s%>
So that his life <S%H9130><s%> loathes <S%H2092><s%> bread, <S%H3899><s%> And his soul <S%H5315><s%> favorite <S%H8378><s%> food. <S%H3978><s%>
"His flesh <S%H1320><s%> wastes <S%H3615><s%> away <S%H3615><s%> from sight, <S%H7210><s%> And his bones <S%H6106><s%> which were not seen <S%H7210><s%> stick <S%H8192><s%> out.
"Then his soul <S%H5315><s%> draws <S%H7126><s%> near <S%H7126><s%> to the pit, <S%H7845><s%> And his life <S%H9130><s%> to those who bring <S%H4191><s%> death. <S%H4191><s%>

"If <S%H518><s%> there <S%H3426><s%> is an angel <S%H4397><s%> [as] mediator <S%H9238><s%> for him, One <S%H259><s%> out of a thousand, <S%H505><s%> To remind <S%H5046><s%> a man <S%H120><s%> what <S%H3477><s%> is right <S%H3476><s%> for him,

Then let him be gracious <S%H2603><s%> to him, and say, <S%H559><s%> 'Deliver <S%H6308><s%> him from going <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to the pit, <S%H7845><s%> I have found <S%H4672><s%> a ransom <S%H3724><s%>';

Let his flesh <S%H1320><s%> become <S%H7375><s%> fresher <S%H7375><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> in youth, <S%H5290><s%> Let him return <S%H7725><s%> to the days <S%H3117><s%> of his youthful <S%H5934><s%> vigor; <S%H5934><s%>

Then he will pray <S%H6279><s%> to God, <S%H433><s%> and He will accept <S%H7521><s%> him, That he may see <S%H7200><s%> His face <S%H6440><s%> with joy, <S%H8643><s%> And He may restore <S%H7725><s%> His righteousness <S%H6666><s%> to man. <S%H582><s%>

"He will sing <S%H7891><s%> to men <S%H376><s%> and say, <S%H559><s%> 'I have sinned <S%H2398><s%> and perverted <S%H9389><s%> what <S%H3477><s%> is right, <S%H3474><s%> And it is not proper <S%H9586><s%> for me.
'He has redeemed <S%H6299><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> from going <S%H5674><s%> to the pit, <S%H7845><s%> And my life <S%H9130><s%> shall see <S%H7200><s%> the light. <S%H216><s%>'
"Behold, <S%H2005><s%> God <S%H410><s%> does <S%H6466><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> these <S%H428><s%> oftentimes <S%H6471><s%> <S%H7969><s%> with men, <S%H1397><s%>
To bring <S%H7725><s%> back <S%H7725><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%> from the pit, <S%H7845><s%> That he may be enlightened <S%H215><s%> with the light <S%H216><s%> of life. <S%H9132><s%>
"Pay <S%H7181><s%> attention, <S%H7181><s%> O Job, <S%H347><s%> listen <S%H8085><s%> to me; Keep <S%H2790><s%> silent <S%H2790><s%> and let me speak. <S%H1696><s%>
"[Then] if <S%H518><s%> you have <S%H3426><s%> anything <S%H4405><s%> to say, <S%H4405><s%> answer <S%H7725><s%> me; Speak, <S%H1696><s%> for I desire <S%H2654><s%> to justify <S%H6663><s%> you.
"If <S%H518><s%> not, listen <S%H8085><s%> to me; Keep <S%H2790><s%> silent, <S%H2790><s%> and I will teach <S%H502><s%> you wisdom. <S%H2451><s%>"
